report_title: Industry Report on Online Hardware and Tool Sales
executive_summary: The industry has seen tremendous expansion in recent years due to positive trends like the growing popularity of online shopping. Consumers prefer online retailers for convenience, wider product selection and competitive pricing. However, intense competition has pressured industry profit as retailers engage in price wars. Revenue is expected to grow at 9.0% CAGR to $35.5 billion over the past five years, including 3.2% growth in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Increased consumer spending is expected to drive industry growth as consumers regain confidence as the adverse effects of 2020 fade. Rising disposable income and declining unemployment will likely boost demand.
Online retailers have leveraged technology like secure payment methods, data analytics, 3D product views and generous return policies to enhance the shopping experience and drive growth.

High competition has forced retailers to adopt strategies like aggressive price competition, seasonal promotions and discounts to stay competitive. Technological advancements have also lowered barriers to entry.
A surge in DIY home improvement projects, driven by factors like home improvement TV shows and the pandemic, has supported growth in demand for hardware and tools.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The need for new tools will increase with more home remodeling projects. Online sales will grow as customers prefer the convenience and budget options over physical stores. Online retailers will benefit from lower operational costs.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: E-tailers to focus on boosting traffic
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Competition will intensify, so e-tailers will focus on improving the online experience through better product descriptions, competitive prices, lower delivery costs and using algorithms for product recommendations to retain customers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Sustainable practices to grow in importance
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consumers are increasingly interested in sustainable products and eco-friendly business practices. Companies will need to consider their environmental footprint from production to shipping and disposal.

industry_definition: This industry retails a broad range of building renovation equipment and supplies via the internet. Hardware, plumbing, electrical and paint-related supplies and tools are the most commonly listed goods.
key_trends: Internally, industry operators compete on the basis of price, product selection, descriptions, website experience, privacy and delivery
E-tailers of hardware and tools encounter competition from traditional brick-and-mortar retailers, including hardware stores, home improvement stores and even mass merchandisers like Walmart
The industry has experienced significant growth in revenue, employment and the number of enterprises in the current period due to the shift towards online shopping
Online retailers prioritize their online presence and e-commerce capabilities to cater to the growing demand for online shopping
Online hardware and tool retailers are not subject to many industry specific regulations but must adhere to common labor and safety laws
Over the past decade, e-commerce sites have opened at a rapid rate, leading to intense competition among industry operators which has hampered profit margins
Purchases are the largest expense for online hardware and tool retailers as they must purchase inventory and keep products stocked
Establishments are heavily concentrated in the West region of the United States which is suited well due to large population and developed transportation networks

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment generally consists of homeowners purchasing new products and completing their own projects and installations. The DIY market has steadily increased, despite a decrease in the unemployment rate and an increase in disposable income.

Many products retailed by this industry require specific knowledge. The installation and operation of many of the devices sold by this sector require specialized skills. In addition to qualified tradesmen (including electricians and plumbers), this market also features landscapers, property managers and maintenance specialists.

This market segment includes sales to other retailers for resale, wholesalers for resale, repair shops, restaurants and other business for end use. There has been consistent demand from this market segment as online shopping remains a popular platform for businesses to purchase from. The convenience and ease of price comparison has contributed to this demand.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment includes power tools and equipment, like portable electric power tools, bench top power tools, hardware, nonpower hand tools and other building materials, supplies and accessories.
This product segment includes home lawn and garden goods, farm and agriculture supplies and equipment.
This segment includes sales of wallpaper and other flexible wall coverings and sales of paint and sundries.
Various miscellaneous hardware not categorized elsewhere.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The percentage of services conducted online
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The percentage of services conducted online reflects consumer preferences toward purchasing items and conducting services online. As a growing share of services is conducted online, demand for online retail stores has consequently grown. A rise in the percentage of services conducted online represents a potential opportunity for online hardware and tool retailers.

business_locations.location_description: Online hardware and tool retailers locate in the West region of the US because of the high population density and the efficient logistics infrastructure in the region.

The acceptance of e-commerce and internet usage has increased quickly in the Southeast, fostering a climate that is favorable for the development of online platforms for the selling of tools and hardware. Also, this region is observing a real estate boom, leading to high demand for hardware and tool supplies used in construction, residential upgrades and property development. Another reason online retailers are drawn to the region is the presence of many major seaports, highways and airports which makes delivery and distribution of online orders more efficient.

The Mid-Atlantic region is home to several major cities known for their technological innovation and vibrant startup ecosystems. Cities like New York City and Washington, D.C., have a strong presence of tech companies, research institutions and venture capital companies. The region benefits from a well-established distribution and logistics infrastructure, with major ports, airports and transportation networks. This infrastructure supports the efficient movement of goods, including hardware and tools, both domestically and internationally.
This region's diverse population and economic activities support the growth of online retailers.
The Southwest is known for its rapid urbanization and development, contributing to an increase in demand for hardware and tools.
The Rockies are characterized by a growing market of DIY consumers and a robust online retail presence.
This region has fewer establishments but still a notable presence in the online hardware and tools market.
Established market with historical significance in retailing, albeit with fewer physical establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) significantly impacts online hardware and tools retailers by regulating minimum wage, overtime pay and child labor. This means businesses must compensate their employees properly for all hours worked, including paying time-and-a-half for overtime and ensuring minors are not employed in hazardous conditions. These regulations help empower employees, promote fair business practices and mitigate misuse of labor in the industry.

E-commerce regulations impact online hardware and tools retailers by setting rules for digital transactions. They include consumer rights laws ensuring accurate product descriptions and fair pricing. Privacy and data protection laws govern customer data usage. Additionally, digital advertising guidelines ensure ethical marketing. Internet sales tax regulations vary by location and can affect pricing. Compliance to these regulations is vital for legal operations, customer trust and business growth.

factors_increased_barrier: Setting up a business in the Online Hardware and Tool Sales industry entails significant start-up capital costs. Operators need to purchase all the equipment they plan to sell or rent out, which can pose a financial barrier for new entrants.

basis_points.basis_title: Price, product selection, descriptions, website experience, privacy and delivery options
basis_points.basis_description: Internally, industry operators compete on the basis of price, product selection, descriptions, website experience, privacy and delivery options.
E-tailers of hardware and tools encounter competition from traditional brick-and-mortar retailers, including hardware stores, home improvement stores and even mass merchandisers like Walmart.

basis_points.basis_title: Brick-and-mortar retailers competing on price, product selection, in-store experience and customer service
basis_points.basis_description: Increasingly, physical stores are competing on price, product selection, in-store experience and customer service.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Relatively Low Barriers to Entry Limits Market Share Concentration
concentration_points.concentration_description: The online retail landscape has relatively low barriers to entry compared to traditional brick-and-mortar stores. Setting up an online hardware and tool sales platform requires less capital investment and infrastructure compared to establishing physical stores. The lower entry barriers encourage new entrants, contributing to a larger number of competitors and lower market concentration.

concentration_points.concentration_title: The Wide Range of Industry Products Keeps Concentration Moderate
concentration_points.concentration_description: The Online Hardware and Tool Sales industry encompasses a wide range of products, including various tools, equipment and hardware items. This diversity in product offerings allows niche players to cater to specific customer segments and product categories. The presence of specialized retailers and marketplaces catering to different customer needs further disperses market concentration.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Customers' Tendency to Compare Prices and Products Across Platforms
concentration_points.concentration_description: Online consumers often prefer to compare prices, products, and reviews across different platforms before making a purchase. This behavior encourages them to explore multiple online retailers, leading to a more fragmented market. Customers' tendency to seek the best deals and options drives competition among retailers and contributes to lower market concentration.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: The Volume of Merchandise Purchased Follows Overall Sales Trends
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The majority of purchases are made from domestic or foreign manufacturers and distributors to resell to customers. The number of products purchased mirrors yearly sales trends.

E-commerce websites have popped up at a rapid rate during the past 10 years, creating fierce competition among business owners. Because many smaller operators have tried to entice customers with promotions and other benefits, like free delivery, which cannot be passed on to the customer, this rivalry has marginally impacted their profit margin.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Although the industry operates online, businesses still rely on labor for a variety of tasks. Employees are needed for customer service, purchasing inventory and other day-to-day tasks.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The Online Hardware and Tool Sales industry has experienced a moderate level of revenue volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: The industry operates in a competitive market with multiple online retailers offering hardware and tool products. This competition tends to stabilize revenue fluctuations as companies strive to maintain market share by adjusting prices, improving customer service and enhancing their product offerings.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The popularity of online shopping helps limit volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: The Online Hardware and Tool Sales industry has been experiencing growth in recent years because of the increasing popularity of online shopping. As more consumers turn to the internet for purchasing hardware and tools, the overall revenue tends to stabilize.
As the market size expands, this growth, accompanied by a broader customer base, helps mitigate revenue volatility by providing a larger pool of potential customers.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR) technologies have impacted online retailers by transforming the way customers engage with products and make purchasing decisions. By leveraging AR and VR, online retailers have been able to provide immersive and interactive experiences that bridge the gap between the physical and digital realms.

Mobile apps have become a key innovation in the online hardware and tool sales industry, enabling customers to access a wide range of products and make purchases conveniently through their smartphones or tablets. These dedicated applications offer numerous features and functionalities that enhance the overall shopping experience, providing customers with a seamless and personalized journey.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Most industry operators offer a wide array of products, as they must compete with large, well-known operators.

FAQs.question: Does your company have a diversified client base, or are sales heavily dependent on one market (consumers, businesses, government)? How has demand from these segments been altered since the start of the coronavirus pandemic?
FAQs.answer: While household consumers make up the largest market for industry operators, catering to the needs of both professional and do-it-yourself has proven valuable.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities in order to expand reach and reduce overhead expenses?
FAQs.answer: As the industry gets more competitive and consolidated, mergers and acquisitions will increase.

FAQs.question: Have rising input costs negatively affected your company's sales? What are the potential threats to business that come from higher oil prices?
FAQs.answer: Rising input costs have not had a major effect on industry revenue, as operators have benefited from low operational costs, enabling many to sell their products at a far lower price than brick-and-mortar stores.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: While wage costs have been historically low for industry operators, due to the lack of storefront, automation has enabled operators to reduce wage costs further, utilizing automated systems in warehouses and for shipping procedures.

FAQs.question: How have you optimized your company website for customer ease of use?
FAQs.answer: Operators' websites must be user friendly by incorporating easy-to-use search engines. Increasingly, industry operators have introduced mobile applications enabling consumers to make purchases via smartphones and tablets.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently? Has there been any new regulation relating to the pandemic that has had an adverse impact on business?
FAQs.answer: The Supreme Court ruled that state-imposed internet sales tax is legal. This has been an area of significant cost savings for online retailers in past years; thus, profit may take a blow due to the change in regulation.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: There are several trade associations that promote the industry and disseminate information. The Internet Merchants Association assists in the development, promotion and protection of internet retailers through education and networking.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit compare with your main competitors'? How has profit been affected by the coronavirus pandemic?
FAQs.answer: While the industry does experience high market share concentration, larger operators do not generally post drastically higher profit figures than smaller operators.

FAQs.question: Do you have any big projects on the horizon that will require capital financing? Have you been able to secure any recent financing to capitalize on lower interest rates?
FAQs.answer: The most competitive and successful operators have warehouses across the country, enabling them to save on shipping costs and provide competitive prices. Thus, operators seeking to open new facilities in the coming years will have the greatest advantage.

FAQs.question: What do you do to promote loyalty and to keep your customers returning for follow-up visits? How have you generated a loyal customer base in the past?
FAQs.answer: Operators must aim to create a loyal customer base who will become repeat buyers due to the products offered, competitive pricing and quality customer.

FAQs.question: How quickly can new technology be adopted? Does your company keep up to date with the latest technology?
FAQs.answer: Ever-changing software systems, internet speeds and personal information security systems require operators to continually update their business to keep pace with recent technology.

FAQs.question: Do you have a good reputation for excellent customer service? How do you hire the best skilled workers?
FAQs.answer: Operators need to ensure that adequate stock controls are in place to reduce inventory costs and increase stock turns.

FAQs.question: How do fluctuating oil prices affect your company? Would you be able to pass on these costs to your customers?
FAQs.answer: Shipping companies raise their prices when oil prices are high, limiting industry profit. Moreover, many companies offer free shipping to premium members, thereby limiting their ability to pass on shipping cost increases.

FAQs.question: In what ways will your business benefit from the expected increase in consumer spending as the economy improves?
FAQs.answer: Consumer spending is a major factor in determining the quantity and quality of online purchases. When overall spending is high, consumers are more likely to purchase discretionary, price-premium goods, benefiting the industry.

FAQs.question: What proportion of your demand is linked to home improvements? How do you plan to capitalize on this opportunity in recent years amid the ongoing pandemic?
FAQs.answer: The growth in do-it-yourself (DIY) projects has enabled many consumers to personally complete home alterations and additions, boosting industry demand.
